availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James B. Powell (Butler County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier - pvt. 11th Ky. Cav.)

body.p: Butler County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Sterling Powell and Araminta Powell. Married to Martha Belcher Powell in Logan County, Kentucky, on September 6, 1865. Resident of Smith County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farm laborer in Butler County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from May 14, 1862, to September 21, 1863. Captured at the Battle of Buffington Island, Meigs County, Ohio, on July 19, 1863. Prisoner of war at Camp Morton, Marion County, Indiana, from July 23, 1863, to August 18, 1863. Prisoner of war at Camp Douglas, Chicago, Cook County, Illinois, from August 22, 1863. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private and second sergeant from September 21, 1863

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Smith County, South Division, pp. 368B-369A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Butler County, pp. 930-1.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, Fillmore Precinct, p. 346.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 014.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 110.
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Logan County Marriages, Film 002134965.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 25672.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 312.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Roll 377, Application 290690, Certificate 191428.
KYR-0002-227-0001.
